alert.note: Alert for St. Clair (Michigan) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 04 at 8:35PM EDT by NWS Detroit
info.description: ...Thunderstorms in northern St. Clair County through 930 PM EDT... At 832 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms along a line extending from near Emmett to near Imlay City. Movement was southeast at 15 mph. HAZARD...Heavy rainfall and wind gusts around 30 mph. A brief funnel cloud is also possible. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Localized flooding of prone areas is possible. Gusty winds could blow around unsecured objects. Thunderstorms will be near... Marysville around 920 PM EDT. Memphis around 930 PM EDT. Other locations impacted by these storms include Riley Center, Fort Gratiot, Allenton, Avoca, Berville, Lynn Township, Goodells, Brockway, Smiths Creek and Ruby. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall may lead to localized road flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
